column9: I'm not quite done with the course of this medication, but I think it's going to work for my skin.  For the person with the hyperhidrosis, you shouldn't use the Hypercare with anything else.  Apply it every night until you're dry for a full day, then as needed.  I've been using it for years, and I never sweat under my arms, on my face, or even my hands any more.

column2: Andi1665, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just started taking this medicationa  couple of days ago.  I am going to continue for at least a week, but since I started I have been feeling rather nauseous.  I will give it time to see if it the medication or something else.To the person with the body odor.  My niece has some of these same issues.  She used to always smell like onions.  The doctor determined that using antibacterial soap was not good for her.  It cleaned her body too good and removed all the natural bacteria on her body.  She has since used a product available from the pharmacist called "hibaclens" (not sure about the spelling).  She has had not problems since.  This product is expensive but it works great.
